entry.title: Processing exception during a "Render" operation. .ProcessingException: IO error detected while open
entry.content:
Hi Gurus,

 I am working on adobe form and I am facing system error  as show below.

 


 I have done all the three tests of ADS
FP_TEST_00
FP_CHECK_DESTINATION_SERVICE
FP_PDF_TEST_00

All the three reports are giving the results as expected .

Earlier I did not understand what the system error is about. After going through few threads I could able to trace from where the error is coming and what the error is about.

CREATE_OUTPUT_CURRENT_FORM is the subroutine where I could able to capture the error.

The following is the error :

Processing exception during a "Render" operation. Request start time: Tue Apr 08 14:40:29 IST 2025 com.adobe.ProcessingException: com.adobe.ProcessingException: IO error detected while opening DEST connection: http://100.64.109.143:8080/sap/bc/fp/form/layout/ZMATERIAL_EXP_QA_CHECK2.XDP?fp-language=EN&fp-mlayout-sup=X&fp-cacheinfo=2025-04-07T05:34:18Z$5ef403a9-256d-4ee3-aaef-7f7832056b50$0$en$v1.0$ Exception Stack Trace: com.adobe.

NOTE : I am getting this error only in quality system . It is working fine in Development system.
Can you please let me know what is the cause of this system error and how to fix it. ?


I could able to find one post where the issue is the same as above and solution was offered to open backend system port connection from portal side. The thread is the below one. It is not clear to how to do it.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/problem-trying-read-data-from-destination/qaq-p/4290340

entry.title: Details required on the usage of communication users
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

 

We are planning to change icf/reject_expired_passwd and rfc/reject_expired_passwd parameters to the value 1 in the systems and before changing the parameter value, we have collected the communication users list for which we need to change the initial user passwords. Before changing the passwords we would like to get the details of RFC's or any other connection name where the users are being used in the interface systems, Can you please share the details like is there any reports or a table on how to fetch the details from the system.

 

 

Thank you.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Intermittent Http_Communication_Failure Error in ABAP Using IF_HTTP_CLIENT->receive
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am intermittently encountering the exception Http_Communication_Failure in my ABAP code when using the method IF_HTTP_CLIENT->receive to send data to external systems (in my case, SAP CPI).

Upon analyzing the short dump, I noticed the following error message:
Connect to hostaddress:443 failed: NIECONN_REFUSED (-10),
and the system variable ME->M_ECODE has the value 411.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue or have any suggestions on how to resolve this?

Thanks in advance,
Ravi Bharti

entry.title: SBGRFCMON How to lock a bgRFC Inbound destination which is empty ?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

we leverage bgRFC queued inbound scenario and like to test the processing. For this, we like to lock our inbound destination in SBGRFCMON. But as long as there are no deleted/failed queue entries for this destination, it is not shown ... so we cannot lock it.

In SMQS we can just register an inactive queue and all entries are queued unprocessed. Similar functionality seems to miss at bgRFC monitor

Example:
These are our available inbound destinations configured

and the bgRFC monitor shows only the ones with entries but not all.

Any ideas how to lock (stop processing of bgRFC inbound queue entries) for a given destination ?

Thanks & best regards,
  Matthias

entry.title: What is the best way to have an external API make a UPDATE/POST call into SAP RDC?
entry.content: Trying to run a postman call into SAP to build a tool for automating erp implementations. RFC seems to be too outdated, so I need a minimum viable path into doing this.

entry.title: Error rfc in cloud foundry with jco: There is no SAP Cloud Connector (SCC) connected
entry.content:
Hi ,
in my application deployed on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, I am trying to connect via RFC using the JCo libraries to an on-premise SAP service.
However, I encounter the following error:

Code
 
failed: There is no SAP Cloud Connector (SCC) connected to your subaccount matching the requested tunnel for subaccount "JCoSingleTenantKyma" and SCC location ID "ENGLAND". Check the configuration on SCC and cloud side. (remote system is [<unknown>])","level":"WARN","SERVER":"main","written_ts":"1747902844351120977","logger":"com.sap.conn.jco","HOST":"8dc4ba91-c82c-4fbc-4dd3-b9dc","written_at":"2025-05-22T08:34:04.350Z","thread":"main","type":"log"}

To clarify:

  • The destination in SAP BTP successfully passes the connection test with the Cloud Connector.
  • My application correctly retrieves the destination data and only fails at this call:
Java
 
JCoDestination destination = JCoDestinationManager.getDestination(destinationName);
System.out.println("Get destination ==>  " + destination.getDestinationID());
destination.ping();
  • On the Cloud Connector side, the destination is green, so it passes the tests.
  • There are no discrepancies with the various subaccounts; I have checked the IDs and they match both in SAP BTP and in SCC.

What could be the cause of this?

entry.title: Calling NW RFC SDK methods from go environment
entry.content:
Developing a go library to execute RFC using NW RFC SDK

I'm able to,

- open connection 

- close connection

- execute RFCs 

But the method RfcGetParameterDescByName is not returning correct data

It returns correct parameter name in paramDesc property. But rest of the attributes like nucLength, ucLength have value as 0.  _type is either RFC_CHAR or RFC_NULL all the time.

Note: I'm able to read function name from function description handle using RfcGetFunctionName method and number of output parameters using RfcGetParameterCount method

entry.title: node rfc server issue being unreliable
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I set up a node rfc server according to the official documentation. https://github.com/SAP-archive/node-rfc/blob/HEAD/doc/usage.md#nodejs-server-program-example

I set up the ini file, the rfc destination (which successfully passes the connection test), the sec_info, and reg_info.

I'm calling the Node.js RFC function from ABAP using a CALL FUNCTION ... DESTINATION statement.

The issue is sometimes it works and sometimes not. Once it executes the node js function I defined successfully then I restart the server again and then I get the error that the function module (name of the function) not found.

I could not find a reasonable pattern that under what condition it works and under what condition it does not.

I appreciate any help.

I can provide my full codes if needed.

Thanks in advance

@Srdjan

entry.title: Email notification trigger to internal requestor when PO change via background job
entry.content:
Hello Guru,

We have built a program in SAP ECC to close SRM POs. When users close the SRM PO via a background job, an email notification is triggered and sent to the requestor. This issue only occurs when the PO is closed using a background job. Has anyone else experienced this issue before? How can we prevent the email notification from being triggered when the PO is closed via a background job?

entry.title: Re: node rfc server issue being unreliable
entry.content:
Looks like you have two instances of the server running? One which has the required definition of the FM you call, and one that doesn't. The ABAP system then does "load balancing" and sometimes calls the correctly configured server program and sometimes the other one... 🙂

That is the only plausible explanation, because a server program simply does not "sometimes know the incoming FM and sometimes doesn't know it"...

Check "SMGW --> Logged on Clients" in order to see, how many registered server connections for the given Program ID (TP Name) exist.

entry.title: read infotype 0015 with RFC function module
entry.content:
Hi,

for PA0008 I found fm HR_ECM_UI_VIEW_SALARY_DATA.

Module must RFC enabled, I collect data outside from SAP with Data Service.

Now I need to read the 0015 to get the addition salary. Some values are direct in this table but in Germany we have e.g. T-Zug A salary ( One-off payments depending on tariff ) , this value is 0 in table and should be e.g. 500 €, shown in tx PA20.

 

Thx

entry.title: Clean Core approach to migrate custom onpremise RFC ABAP Function Module
entry.content:
Hello! I have questions about ABAP, Clean Core and RFC. 

A company has an custom addon/software component that is installed on on-premise systems. ECC, S/4, SRM, CRM. These systems communicate each other via the addon. The addon communicates using RFC connections based on custom ABAP Function Modules.

Company wants to make the addon "clean core compliant". And some questions like these arised:

1 - is rfc connection between onpremise systems clean core compliant?

2 - if the previous answer is no, how to make rfc connections clean core without put everything inside cds custom entity and expose as odata service?

3 - make onpremise abap programs clean core means always expose data as odata service using rap?

entry.title: Ü is creating SAPSQL_PARSE_ERROR
entry.content:
The character Ü being present in a users name is creating "SAPSQL_PARSE_ERROR" when attempting to to execute an ABAP RFC call from node red. Any assistance in this would be greatly appreciated.

The RFC call in question is "RFC_ TABLE_READ", which SAP will not provide support on due it being a "banned" RFC function.
